授業目的:
Course title: Labour Mobility and Population Imbalance in the EU
You will learn about the (social, economic　& fiscal) benefits of labour mobility in the EU, and learn why too high levels of mobility and emigration could also pose a risk.
We will use examples from different EU countries, including Germany, Italy, Bulgaria, Latvia and Rumania to learn why people move to another (EU) country, thereby understanding different societies, their labour markets, and their long-term problems.

This course hopes to provide a deeper understanding of migration and labour mobility in the EU. In order to better understand the development in the EU, we will also look at migration to Japan as well as Japan's shrinking rural population.
到達目標:
This course has multiple learning goals:
1) Understand contemporary EU politics
2) learn about European culture & societies
3) analyse developments in different European countries and compare them with Japan
4) acquire soft skills, such as Academic English, presentation skills, discussion skills, critical & analytical thinking and independent research skills
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: The course will be conducted as a seminar, and active student participation is expected.

第1回: Introduction to Labour Mobility and Migration in the EU: history, policies; Labour Mobility trends after 2004
第2回: Labour Mobility from the new member states to the UK, Germany and the Benelux countries
第3回: Labour Mobility from Poland and Romania to the UK since 2004 and its influence on Brexit
第4回: The economic & social impact of labour mobility in the EU
第5回: From a recipient of labour mobility to a supplier of migrant workers: Spain
第6回:
Impact of labour mobility on population imbalances in the EU: overview
Rural depopulation in Japan
第8回: Population decline and population ageing EU countries
第9回: Efforts to combat rural depopulation in Japan & the EU
第10回: Efforts to combat rural depopulation in Japan & the EU
第11回: Covid-19 and the rising interest in countryside life: why do people want to move away from the cities?
第12回: Covid-19 and the rising interest in countryside life: why do people want to move away from the cities?
